com.vector.cfg.automation.api

Class ScriptApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vector.cfg.automation.api.ScriptApi

  • @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public final class ScriptApi
extends java.lang.Object
    ScriptApi provides static entry point methods to many Automation APIs.
    In your own methods and classes the automation API is not automatically available differently as inside of the script task code{ } block. But it is often the case, that methods need access to the automation API.

    The class ScriptApi provides static methods as entry points into the automation API. The static methods either return the API objects, or you could pass a Closure, which will activate the API inside of the Closure.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    See Also:
    IScriptExecutionContext

    • Method Detail

      • activeProject

        @PublishedMethod
public static IProject activeProject()
        The activeProject() method provides access to the project automation API of the currently active project. This is useful, when you want to call project API inside of your own methods and classes.

        The activeProject() method returns the current active IProject. 

         
 def yourMethod(){
      // Needs access to an automation API
      IProject theActiveProject = ScriptApi.activeProject()
 }
        Returns:
        the current active IProject.
        See Also:
        IProject

      • activeProject

        @PublishedMethod
public static <T> T activeProject(@VDelegatesToWithClosureParam(value=IProject.class)
                                                    groovy.lang.Closure<T> code)
        The activeProject() method provides access to the project automation API of the currently active project. This is useful, when you want to call project API inside of your own methods and classes.

        The method will call the passed Closure with the current active IProject as delegate. 

         
 def yourMethod(){
      // Needs access to an automation API
      ScriptApi.activeProject{
          // Project API is now available
          transaction{
              // Now model modifications are allowed
          }
      }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the return type
        Parameters:
        code - the code to call with the active IProject.
        Returns:
        the return value of the called user Closure.
        See Also:
        IProject

      • daVinci

        @PublishedMethod
public static void daVinci(@VDelegatesToWithClosureParam(value=IScriptCreationApiWithFields.class)
                                             groovy.lang.Closure<?> code)
        The ScriptApi#daVinci() method provides the entry point into the IScriptCreationApi during script initialization. The main use it to enable the IDE code completion support in a script file.
        The IDE could not know which API is available inside of a script file. So a glue code is needed to tell the IDE, what API is callable inside of a script file.

        The ScriptApi#daVinci() method enables the IDE code completion support in a script file. You have to write the daVinci{ } block and inside of the block the code completion is available. The following sample shows the glue code for the IDE:

        See automation documentation for a usage sample.

        Parameters:
        code - the initialization code to execute
        See Also:
        IScriptCreationApi

      • getActiveProject

        @PublishedMethod
public static IProject getActiveProject()
        The activeProject() method provides access to the project automation API of the currently active project. This is useful, when you want to call project API inside of your own methods and classes.

        The activeProject() method returns the current active IProject.

        Returns:
        the current active IProject.
        See Also:
        IProject

      • getScriptLogger

        @PublishedMethod
public static ILogger getScriptLogger()
        The getScriptLogger() method provides access active script logger of the currently executed script task.
        Returns:
        the logger of the currently executed script task.

      • scriptCode

        @PublishedMethod
public static IScriptExecutionContext scriptCode()
        The scriptCode() method provides access to all automation APIs defined in the IScriptExecutionContext (inside of the normal script code{} block. This is useful, when you want to call script code API inside of your own methods and classes.

        The scriptCode() without a Closure method returns the currently running IScriptExecutionContext. This can be used to call API in Java style. 

         
 def yourMethod(){
      // Needs access to an automation API
      ScriptApi.scriptCode().workflow.update()
 }
        Returns:
        the currently running IScriptExecutionContext.

      • scriptCode

        @PublishedMethod
public static <T> T scriptCode(@VDelegatesToWithClosureParam(value=IScriptExecutionContext.class)
                                                 groovy.lang.Closure<T> code)
        The scriptCode(Closure) method provides access to all automation APIs defined in the IScriptExecutionContext (inside of the normal script code{} block. This is useful, when you want to call script code API inside of your own methods and classes.

        The method will call the passed Closure with the running IScriptExecutionContext as delegate. 

         
 def yourMethod(){
      // Needs access to an automation API
      ScriptApi.scriptCode{
          // API is now available
          workflow.update()
      }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the return type
        Parameters:
        code - the code to call
        Returns:
        the return value of the called user Closure.
